results.title: Wayang Kulit
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain, Tom Hodge and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows a travelling troupe, the touring Wayang Kulit or shadow play men, in Malaya. Follows the troupe as it provides this traditional entertainment in the villages and kampongs of Malaya’s east coast.

results.title: Way to your neighbour
results.brief_description: A collaborative micro-cinema curiosity from the declining years of the Zagreb animation studio. An animated sarcastic response to the current political situation in the world. The film has no commentary but a musical accompaniment. This is another of the Zagreb Studio’s hallucinatory premonitions of the Yugoslav Republic’s trip to hell in a handbag.

results.title: Way to Wimbledon
results.creator_credit: Franklin Gollings and Pathe Documentary Unit
results.brief_description:
Goes behind the scenes of the Wimbledon Tennis Championships and shows the care of the courts and the many and varied preparations for the tournaments.
Narrated by John Mills.

results.title: Way to new homes: a Swedish approach to the housing problem
results.brief_description: Slum abolition and housing projects in the university city of Uppsala, Sweden. Compares favourable living conditions in a modern suburb with the slums, and associated child delinquency, in othe parts of the city. Under Government and municipal housing schemes, the city is being reconstructed and individual homes and blocks of apartments built on a tenant ownership system to accommodate white collar workers, students, and labourers. Aspects of the scheme include low rentals, housing subsidies, rebates on yearly rents for each child under sixteen, well planned playgrounds, and hobby-rooms for recreation.

results.title: Way down east [DVD]
results.brief_description: A country girl is tricked into a fake marriage by a lecherous playboy. He deserts her when she becomes pregnant. After the death of the baby she seeks refuge in the house of a puritanical squire. The melodramatic cliche of the original play is transformed, suffused with the timelessness of myth by Griffith and the principal players. The extraordinary delicacy and intensity of Gish is well complemented by the playing of Barthelmess as the country boy. The final scenes of fragility against the elements in the blizzard and on the icefloe (filmed at some risk to Gish and Barthelmess) is a tour-de-force of staging, composition and editing. Based on the play by Lottie Blair Parker, William Brady and Joseph R. Grisner. Cast includes Lillian Gish, Richard Barthelmess and Lowell Sherman. With musical soundtrack recorded in 1928 by Louis Silvers. This version was fully restored by film historian David Shepard.

results.title: Way back when (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Interactive Design Group, Board of Studies NSW
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM has been designed to allow Secondary level students to step back in time to Colonial Australia in a refreshingly new and interactive way. Structured for enquiry learning, students can explore hundreds of important aspects of colonial time through pictures, text, spoken word, poems and movies. Some of the issues covered include the reaction of indigenous Australians to Europeans, the legal system and how it changed, the changing roles of women and numerous aspects of the development of Australian society. Aimed at assisting teachers, this interactive tour would be a useful aid in the syllabus of English, Human Society and its Environment, Science and Technology, and Visual Arts. Minimum system requirements: 256-colour colour-capable Macintosh with 4 megabytes of RAM, running system 7 or later, with a CD-ROM player, a 12-inch 256 colour screen (on the LC) and a hard disk.

results.title: Way ahead
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Kim Dalton and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the ever increasing problems of the motor car and its alternative, public transport. New improvements in public transport systems throughout the world are examined. Other new ideas, still in the planning stages, are also shown. Animation is ;used to show a possible futurisitic solution of personalised rapid transit. Cinematography by John Leake.

results.title: Wax and wool
results.creator_credit: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In small Mexican villages, the local residents make colourful yarn paintings by pressing wool into a mixture of bee’s wax and resin. Records the fluid convergence of yarn, wax and resin into a two-dimensional design of brilliant colour and beauty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Waves in the ocean: Yrs 8-12
results.brief_description: Shows the beauty and order behind the movement of ocean waves. Includes: generation of waves in water, speed and length, how waves bend and change direction, beach building, reflection and wave motion.
